onHostStart().Description: This method is called when {@link PlaybackGlueHost is started. Subclass may override.

onHostStop().Description: This method is called when {@link PlaybackGlueHost is stopped. Subclass may override.

isPlaying().Description: Returns true if media is currently playing.

Returns: Associated @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ or null if not attached to host.

onHostPause().Description: This method is called when {@link PlaybackGlueHost is paused. Subclass may override.

next().Description: Goes to the next media item. This method is optional.

onDetachedFromHost().Description: This method is called when current associated @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ is attached to a different @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue_E@ or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ is destroyed . Subclass may override and call super.onDetachedFromHost() at last. A typical PlaybackGlue will release resources (e.g. MediaPlayer or connection to playback service) in this method.

Returns: A snapshot of list of PlayerCallbacks set on the Glue.

previous().Description: Goes to the previous media item. This method is optional.

isReadyForPlayback().Description: Use isPrepared() instead. Returns true when the media player is ready to start media playback. Subclasses must implement this method correctly. When returning false, app may listen to @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#PlayerCallback#onReadyForPlayback_E@ event.

onHostResume().Description: This method is called when {@link PlaybackGlueHost is resumed. Subclass may override.

isPrepared().Description: Returns true when the media player is prepared to start media playback. When returning false, app may listen to @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#PlayerCallback#onPreparedStateChanged_E@ event.

ClassDesc: Base class for abstraction of media play/pause feature. A subclass of PlaybackGlue will contain implementation of Media Player or a connection to playback Service. App initializes PlaybackGlue subclass, associated it with a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ is typically implemented by a Fragment or an Activity, it provides the environment to render UI for PlaybackGlue object, it optionally provides SurfaceHolder via @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#SurfaceHolderGlueHost_E@ to render video. A typical PlaybackGlue should release resources (e.g. MediaPlayer or connection to playback Service) in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#onDetachedFromHost_E@. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#onDetachedFromHost_E@ is called in two cases: app manually change it using @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#setHost_E@ call When host (fragment or activity) is destroyed In rare case if an PlaybackGlue wants to live outside fragment / activity life cycle, it may manages resource release by itself.
